sect1.title: &susemgr; Installation Requirements
sect1.para: This chapter will cover the following topics.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: In order to access &suse; vendor channels and updates you will need a registration key for &susemgr;. This key will be provided to you after purchasing the product or you can find this key located at . Login with your &suse; or &novell; credentials. If you are simply testing and will not be installing &susemgr; on a production system, a 60 day evaluation key is available and may be obtained from Once on this page click on TRY SUSE MANAGER. This evaluation key limits the maximum number of client systems that may be registered with SUSE Manager to 10. To enable synchronization from the SUSE software repositories valid &ncc; and or &scc; mirror credentials are required. During the &susemgr; installation these mirror credentials will be requested.

sect1.title: Users and Passwords
sect1.para: During installation there are several users and passwords which must be created or are required. See the following list to fulfil these requirements before installation and keep them secure.

formalpara.title: root
formalpara.para: A Linux root password will be created during installation.

formalpara.title: PostgreSQL and Oracle
formalpara.para: When using PostgreSQL or an Oracle database you will need to create a username and password. These should be stored in a safe location.

formalpara.title: Certificate of Authority
formalpara.para: When generating your CA a password will be created. This password should be stored in a safe place as this will be required to install a &susemgrproxy; Server.

formalpara.title: Administrator
formalpara.para: Upon completing installation you will need to setup an admin user for &susemgr;. This user will have complete access to the system and should not be used for daily operation. A typical username would be admin or smadmin

note.title: Safe Passwords
note.para: Please create a safe password. Be careful when using special characters as this may cause some confusion (eg 0 and O or 1 and l) Some fonts make it difficult to differentiate between these characters.

sect1.title: Network Information
sect1.para: During installation the following network configuration will be required or must be prepared.

listitem.para: Both the DNS Server and the server itself should be resolvable with DNS and when running a reverse lookup.
A proxy server can be used to access the external network when required. Currently NTLM is not supported.
The firewall should allow access to the following ports and protocols: http, https, 80 and 443 respectively.

note.title: Access Tip
note.para: It is also recommended to allow access for *.novell.com and *.suse.com
